attributes.title: Physical Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

·       Aggregate bread difference was Excess of 876 pcs (White Bread) and 22 Pcs (Brown Bread)

·       Aggregated polybags difference was shortfall of 218pcs.

·       Utto difference was Excess of 2.21Kgs.

·       Crate difference was shortfall of 1

The table below illustrates the findings:

Implications

Huge variance on White Bread and Polybags implies weak controls.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.remediation_plan:
All stock transfers between branches will require:

  • A signed Stock Transfer Note (STN) from both sending and receiving Branches.

  • Verification and signature from the security guard on duty.

value:
·       During the Changamwe stock take done by me (Mr. Lucas), 600 pcs of 400g White Bread lacked receipt documentation from Majengo 1 (STN). The Manager and guard must ensure proper transfer records are maintained.

·       Polybags variance was within limits, but going forward, damaged polybags will be added to the physical count.

·       The current tins at the branch use less Utto, resulting in excess Utto during stock take.

Noted.

·       The surplus bread is due to transfers in and out of the branch.

·       Damaged polybags from packers and employees are not added back to the physical count, leading to a shortfall in polybags.

·       Majengo 1 tins use less Utto, with consistent use of parameters and measurements and no additions, resulting in excess Utto.

I have raised a deduction for the Minishop attendant to recover the crate shortfall.

·       In the prior audit report highlighted variations during physical stock verification on.

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of -85 pieces.

Bread Stock: White Bread: Variance of - 134 pieces
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Standard Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       From the selected sample 800g WB OT, 35% were found to be overweight.

The table below summarizes the findings

Implications.

·       The presence of underweight bread expose the company to non-compliance issues.

Overweight bread affects the Yield.
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.

value: ·       The current dividing range is expected to produce more overweight breads. However, an adjustment has been made; raising the lower limit from 458 to 462, which will help reduce cases of overweight bread.
I will do a follow up to ensure the required standard weight is achieved.

· In the prior audit, bread overweight & underweight were noted in

ü  200g WB: 25% overweight

ü  400g White: 21% overweight

800g WB: 8% underweight.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.

Implication

·       The Average yield was within the set target.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.

value:
·       We produce as per orders and transfers requested. However, we will work toward achieving the set production target.

In the month of March we transferred more than what was produced.

·       The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.

On March 2025, there was a breakdown of slicing machine which is still an issue and this affects production.

·       Production target was below the set target – 51 bags per day.

Average yield per bag was 196.3.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production and Market Damages
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Production and market damage rate was analyzed from cash flow date 01/02/2025 - 31/03/2025.

·       It was observed that production and market damages were slightly above the established limits in the month of March, as illustrated below.

February 2025

 

March 2025

Implications

·       Production damages was higher than KPI in the month of February.

·       Market damages was slightly higher than KPI in the month of March.

The above indicates that controls on damages are not effective and this exposes the company to losses.
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.

value:
·       On February Oven breakdown affected more damages.

Market damages on March, were slightly higher than KPI due stiff competition in the town area during the period of Ramadhan. Vendors were choosy on breads and there were also expiry before dates.
We will strengthen controls on production and market damages.
In the prior audit, the production damage was 0.5%, while market damages remained within the set limit at 0.2%.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       The aim is to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags.

·       Production efficiency were analyzed from 15/02/25 – 31/03/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·       Actual production efficiency was 4.3 for the month of February 2025 and 4.42 for the month of March 2025. This is slightly below the set efficiency.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Production efficiency

February 2025

March 2025

Implication

The Production efficiency for both months of February and March was slightly below the KPI. This implies extra cost was incurred to hire extra workers

value: Previous
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set efficiency of 4.5 bags per production worker is attained.

attributes.title: Physical Cash verification and Cash Handling
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical cash was verified on 07/04/2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

Implications.

Cash loss risk is minimal. This implies strong controls.
attributes.recommendation: Observed cash control is commendable

value: The cash controls are effective and will be maintained.
Cash controls are effective.
In the prior audit report, we noted that cash variance of KES +61.
Previous
Operations/Production Department
To confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

· An analysis of the debt balance as at 09/04/2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

· During the audit, it was noted that there were no balances.

Implication

No significant issues were identified in the debtor balances.
attributes.recommendation: · The sales and operations teams should continue maintaining effective controls over debtors.

value: · To be maintained.
We will maintain debtor’s controls.
In the prior audit, no significant outstanding balances were noted.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

· Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done from 1 March to 31 March 2025 to assess compliance to company policies.

Implication

Low fuel consumption. This implies the controls are effective.
attributes.recommendation: A fuel survey should be made on KCW 094A that uses more routes.

value: The fuel consumption of the vehicles is okay.
KCW 094A consumes more since it covers more routes.
No previous audit findings.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Findings.

· A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 7 & 8 April 2025 to assess whether the operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

· The physical quantities of various varieties were compared to the DDS balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

· It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Majengo 1, and Tudor Minishop.

Implications:

The consistency between physical stock and DDS data implies that the internal controls governing the stock counting and recording processes are effective.
attributes.recommendation: The company continues to follow strong reconciliation procedures between the physical counts and the DDS balances.

value: To be maintained.
· Strong controls will be maintained.
No previous findings.
Previous

attributes.title: 10.	 Pastry shop Spot Check and Cash Verification
attributes.description:
· A spot check was conducted on 08/04/2025 to assess whether the operations in Tic Tac Pastry were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

· The physical quantities of various varieties were compared with System balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

·   It was noted that there were minor variances between the physical quantities and the System balances as shown below.

·  It was also noted that the float was short by 505.44 as illustrated below.

Implication

A negative variance of KES 505.44 is an indication of weak controls.
attributes.recommendation: Perform daily reconciliation between physical cash and system records to minimize discrepancies.

value: The difference shall be recovered from the attendants at the end of the month if the situation does not change.
Controls will be strengthened.
No previous findings.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Fuel consumption (Generator)
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

·       Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 65l/hr.

·       Generator fuel consumption from 01/03/2025 – 31/03/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

Implication

The generator consumption was within the set standards. The 56.11 liters per hour is lower than the expected rate, it indicates fuel savings.
attributes.recommendation: ·   Economical fuel consumption by the generator is commendable.

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
The generator fuel consumption is economical.
·   No previous audit findings.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Packing efficiencies were analyzed from 01/02/25 – 31/03/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·       Actual packing efficiency was 92.43 for the month of February 2025 and 95.51 for the month of March 2025 crates per packer which is slightly below the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Packing efficiency (February 2025)

Implications

The company incurred an accumulative extra cost of KES 16,416.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set target.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Inspect and assess the current condition of the slicing machine to confirm wear level and identify specific components causing inefficiencies.

  • Assign maintenance team to perform emergency servicing or part replacements (blades, bearings, calibration) to restore minimum functionality.

value:
·       We shall work toward achieving the target.

·       We are in a process of acquiring a new Slicing Machine.

·       Cutting down production affected the efficiency.

Breakdown of slicing Machine (Worn Out) affected the efficiency.
In the previous audit report, the packing efficiency was 95.2.
Previous
Operations/Production Department
